p:
As shown in Fig. 4c, V OER is lower than E TN(OER) for all samples at all C-rates applied. This can be explained by external heat coming from the environment and implies a negative value for the energy efficiency losses L
el (OER). For a full cell charging with at 4C, the OER energy efficiency losses are estimated at −3.2% for NiFe20 instead of −2.5% for Ni-B inducing a gain in energy efficiency of +0.7% for the doped sample. Combined with the gain in battery energy efficiency, the use of NiFe20 constitutes an increase in total energy efficiency of +1.1 to +1.4%; since the typical full cell efficiency is 80–90%,
1 this constitutes a reduction of the overall full cell losses by 7–14%.
